Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Dexmedetomidine in Acute Brain Injury Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Adults with ABI admitted to the ICU were randomised

Participants.evidence: Adults with ABI admitted to the ICU

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive dexmedetomidine or standard care

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was in-hospital mortality, assessed over the ICU stay

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 7,490 patients were randomised: 1,143 to dexmedetomidine and 6,347 to control

Number_Analysed.evidence: 1,128 patients were analysed in each group using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: Dexmedetomidine was associated with reduced in-hospital mortality (HR 0.37, 95% CI 0.31â€“0.45, p < 0.001)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported
